text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

text: To live a pure unselfish life, one must count nothing as one's own in the midst of abundance.
author: Buddha

text: Eighty percent of success is showing up.
author: Woody Allen

text: Courage is not simply one of the virtues , but the form of every virtue at the testing point.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: A man cannot be comfortable without his own approval.
author: Mark Twain

text: Always acknowledge a fault. This will throw those in authority off their guard and give you an opportunity to commit more.
author: Mark Twain

text: There are only two kinds of people in the end: those who say to God, 'Thy will be done,' and those to whom God says, in the end, 'Thy will be done.'
author: C.S. Lewis

text: Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter and those who matter don't mind.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: When we see men of a contrary character, we should turn inwards and examine ourselves.
author: Confucius

text: A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another.
author: Charles Dickens

text: It is our choices...that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.
author: J.K. Rowling

text: Never trust anything that can think for itself if you can't see where it keeps its brain.
author: J.K. Rowling

text: Sometimes the questions are complicated and the answers are simple.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: Everything comes to him who hustles while he waits.
author: Thomas A. Edison

text: Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.
author: Thomas A. Edison
